alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee; Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 02 at 5:25AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Patchy Dense Fog Developing Over the Interior and Along the Treasure Coast... At 525 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery and traffic cameras showed areas of fog developing from Orlando south to Lake Okeechobee, and along the Treasure Coast from Port Saint Lucie to Sebastian. The fog had become locally dense, with visibilities in some locations dropping to less than one mile. The fog will continue to pose a hazard to drivers early this morning, before burning off between 8 and 9 AM. Drivers should prepare to encounter rapid reductions in visibility from locally dense fog on their morning commute. When driving in dense fog, reduce your speed, use only your low beam headlights, and leave extra following distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you.
